oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Voter reinstatement of Samuel Bogart
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Samuel Bogart served in Co. G, 37th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA but this form claims he was a Union man and he did take the oath of allegiance on Sept. 17, 1863. It is possible that Bogart was a Union man but was conscripted into the Confederate army. This form was required to reestablish his voting rights after the war.
